metadata.title: CVE-2017-2900 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: An exploitable integer overflow exists in the PNG loading functionality of the Blender open-source 3d creation suite version 2.78c. A specially crafted '.png' file can cause an integer overflow resulting in a buffer overflow which can allow for code execution under the context of the application. An attacker can convince a user to use the file as an asset via the sequencer in order to trigger this vulnerability.

criterions.comment: blender package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.79+dfsg0-1').
